column4: Wrong, WUBI is very nice, yet if it's possible to do a clean install, I would do one.
then how does one reinstall grub4dos when it is unable to read the menu.lst equivalent?
There is no grub4dos, huh? WUBI 9.10 uses normal grub2 at least.
ah, ok, well then how does one reinstall grub2 then (I thought it would still be on grub4dos since that's what the documentation seemed to imply)
Eh, whatever. WUBI is nice for windows installation, but meh, normal installs are ALWAYS better.
sudo fdisk -l I guess
Hm. Where did sda2 get to? %) It has sda1 and sda3
I'm innocent :|
meaning: I have no clue ;)
Ah :D
should you have a faulty partition table, testdisk might be able to help..
Meh, I messed with partitions a bit
What do you mean by a "faulty" partition table?

if you know sda3 should be there and it doesn't show up in fdisk, chances are the partition table might have gone a bit whacky, the partition table is a set of bytes at the start of the HD detailing where partions boundries start and end
sda3 shows up, sda2 doesn't. Altough it shouldn't exactly, well, I think I'm starting to make sense of it
if you deleted sda2, it shouldn't no
Yup at least according to som post on the planet
Using the repository version? (Don't)
*ubuntu repo..
Not an idiot. Their site instructs not to use the ubuntu one.
Xubuntu _should_ work on that machine... crunchbang is pretty meh.
(as per Q in +1) No liceCDs yet. Edit your sources.list and apt-it.
Well, wow. Nah that's not something I'd go with... I'd rather run it in a vbox or something :P Oh well whatever
